description: Azerbaijan announced the cancellation of mass events on March 10.
On March 13, visits of relatives of patients treated in medical institutions are prohibited.
Azerbaijan prohibited weddings, funerals, and other public mass gatherings on March 13.

On March 29, access to all boulevards, parks and recreation areas should be restricted in order to regulate the density of people. In other places it's citizens are not allowed to gather in groups of more than 10 people.
From May 4, after the repopening of boulevards, parks and recreation areas, the restriction on gathering in groups more than 10 people continues.

From May 4, restrictions on access to boulevards, parks and recreation areas continues in Baku, Sumgayit, Ganja, Lankaran cities and Absheron district, while it has been lifted in other cities and regions.

From May 4, restrictions on access to boulevards, parks and recreation areas are lifted, in all cities, regions and Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic except Baku, Sumgayit, Ganja, Lankaran cities and Absheron district.
On May 16, the restriction on gathering in groups more than 10 people has been anounced to be continued till May 31.
On May 16, the prohibition of visits of relatives of patients treated in medical institutions continues till May 31.
The duration of prohibited mass gatherings activities have been extended to May 31.

According to the appeal announced on May 15, after the reopening of boulevards, parks and recreation areas also in Baku, Sumgayit, Ganja, Lankaran cities and Absheron district on May 18, the restriction of concentrating in groups of more than 10 people continues.
From May 18, restrictions on access to boulevards, parks and recreation areas have been removed also in Baku, Sumgayit, Ganja, Lankaran and Absheron district.
From May 31, cancellation of mass events is still on with the exception of outdoor sport activities without spectators.
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event

description: From May 31, the restriction on gathering in groups more than 10 people has been extended, in parallel with the extension of quarantine regime.

From May 31, outdoor sports competitions is going to be started without the participation of spectators.
On June 9, the restriction on gathering in groups more than 10 people has been anounced to be continued till July 1.
